t: Psalm 73
God’s Ways Vindicated
A psalm of Asaph.
God*pn is indeed good to Israel, to*ln the pure in heart.
But*ln as for me, my feet almost slipped; my*ln steps nearly went astray.
For*ln I envied the arrogant; I*ln saw the prosperity of the wicked.
They*pn have an easy time until they die, and*ln their bodies are well fed.
They*ln are not in trouble like others; they*ln are not afflicted like most people.
Therefore,*ln pride is their necklace, and*ln violence covers them like a garment.
Their*ln eyes bulge out from fatness; the*ln imaginations of their hearts run wild.
They*ln mock, and they speak maliciously; they*ln arrogantly threaten oppression.
They*ln set their mouths against heaven, and*ln their tongues strut across the earth.
Therefore*ln his people turn to them and*ln drink in their overflowing words.
The*ln wicked say, “How can God know? Does*ln the Most High know everything?”
Look*ln at them - the wicked! They*ln are always at ease, and*ln they increase their wealth.
Did*pn I purify my heart and*ln wash my hands in innocence for nothing?
For*ln I am afflicted all day long and*ln punished every morning.
If*ln I had decided to say these things aloud, I*ln would have betrayed your people.
When*ln I tried to understand all this, it*ln seemed hopeless
until*ln I entered God’s sanctuary. Then*ln I understood their destiny.
Indeed,*ln you put them in slippery places; you*ln make them fall into ruin.
How*ln suddenly they become a desolation! They*ln come to an end, swept away by terrors.
Like*ln one waking from a dream, Lord,*ln when arising, you will despise their image.
When*pn I became embittered and*ln my innermost being was wounded,
I*ln was stupid and didn’t understand; I*ln was an unthinking animal toward you.
Yet*ln I am always with you; you*ln hold my right hand.
You*ln guide me with your counsel, and*ln afterward you will take me up in glory.
Who*ln do I have in heaven but you? And*ln I desire nothing on earth but you.
My*ln flesh and my heart may fail, but*ln God is the strength of my heart, my*ln portion forever.
Those*ln far from you will certainly perish; you*ln destroy all who are unfaithful to you.
But*ln as for me, God’s presence is my good. I*ln have made the Lord God*s my refuge, so*ln I can tell about all you do.
